acceptanceCriteria.criterion: When I navigate to the Interviews page (/interviews), I see two sections: "Needs Feedback" at top + "All Interviews" table below. "Needs Feedback" section shows interviews requiring user action (Awaiting feedback, Overdue). "All Interviews" table shows all interviews with filters, sorted by scheduled date/time (ascending). Each interview shows: company name, job title, round number, interview type badge, date/time, status badge. The page loads within 2 seconds per NFR-2.1.

When I view the interview list: interviews today have orange left border (#f97316); interviews tomorrow or within 7 days have blue left border (primary color); interviews beyond 7 days have no colored border; completed interviews (past + outcome set) show with muted opacity (0.6); "Awaiting feedback" and "Overdue" interviews appear in Needs Feedback section (not main table).

When I look at each interview entry in the main table, status shows as badge pills: "Today" - Orange badge; "Tomorrow" - Blue badge; "in X days" - Blue badge (for 2-7 days out); "—" (dash) - for interviews beyond 7 days; "Passed", "Rejected", etc. - Green/Red badge for completed interviews with outcome. Status badges are calculated client-side without page refresh.

When I use the filter controls, I can filter by: All, Upcoming, Past. Filter selection persists in URL query params (?filter=upcoming). Filter count shows number of matching interviews (e.g., "Showing 5 interviews").

When I have interviews requiring feedback (1-2 days past = "Awaiting feedback", 3+ days past = "Overdue"), I see a collapsible "Needs Feedback" section at the top with yellow/accent border. The section header shows a count badge (e.g., "2" for 2 items needing attention). Each row in this section has an "Add Feedback" action button. The section is hidden when empty (no items need attention).
When I click on an interview entry, I navigate to that interview's detail page (/interviews/:id). The breadcrumb correctly shows "Interviews" as parent.
When I have no interviews, I see a friendly message: "No interviews scheduled" and a call-to-action button: "Add your first interview" linking to application selection.

When the frontend requests interviews, GET /api/interviews returns interviews with application details (company_name, job_title). The API supports query param: filter (all|upcoming|past). Results are sorted by scheduled_date ASC, scheduled_time ASC.

constraints.constraint: Page load must be under 2 seconds per NFR-2.1. API response target: 90% under 500ms.
Follow existing pagination pattern: ?page=1&per_page=20 with meta object in response.
Use existing repository pattern with sqlx for database queries. Filter by user_id for authorization.
Frontend components follow existing structure: PascalCase files, shadcn/ui components, barrel exports in index.ts.
Date display: Use date-fns parseISO and format functions (format "MMM d"). Store dates as ISO 8601 strings.
Soft delete filtering: All queries must include WHERE deleted_at IS NULL.
Two-section layout: "Needs Feedback" section (collapsible, accent border) + "All Interviews" table.
Left border colors: #f97316 (orange) for today, $--primary (blue) for tomorrow/this week, none for future.
Status badges: Today (orange #f97316), Tomorrow (primary), "—" for future, Awaiting (accent), Overdue (destructive).
Completed rows: opacity 0.6, status shows colored dot + text (e.g., green dot + "Passed").
Table columns: Company (120px), Position (fill), Round (70px), Type (100px), Date (100px), Status (100px), Actions (70px).
Filter chips: All/Upcoming/Past with cornerRadius 6, padding [6,12]. Active chip uses primary background.
Needs Feedback section: accent border, accent-muted header background, count badge, "Add Feedback" primary button per row.
Empty state: calendar icon (48px), "No upcoming interviews" title, description, "Schedule Interview" button.
Page uses PageHeader component with breadcrumbs. Link to detail page uses Next.js Link component.
